description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Ota's Charm" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Ota's Charm

places.generalDescription: Roppongi Hills is a bustling commercial complex in Minato City, featuring the iconic 238-meter Mori Tower and a wide array of amenities. This area is part of the Special Zone for Asian Headquarters initiative, aimed at attracting foreign companies with various incentives. The complex houses offices, restaurants, art museums, movie theaters, and TV stations.

sources.snippet: Roppongi Hills is a multi-purpose facility with offices, museums, housing, hotels, a huge cinema etc., and also a cultural origin site where many ideas are born. A sightseeing spot that represents Tokyo. It is good to enjoy the streets of Roppongi around here by driving or you can stop the car and watch the night view of Tokyo from the observatory.
sources.siteName: Popular driving spots in Japan | Jalan Rent-a-Car
sources.shortName: 10 recommended spots to see Tokyo's night view during your driving trip! See the romantic and fantastic scenery - Popular driving spots in Japan

places.name: Roppongi Hills

reviews.text: We stepped into this shopping centre to escape the rain, but were pleasantly surprised by how luxurious and beautiful it was. While wandering around, we accidentally came across the Love Machine Museum, which turned out to be a fantastic and unexpected highlight. A fun and stylish place to explore - even more enjoyable when it's wet outside!

Such a pity that I discovered this place on my last day in Tokyo. Am really not a mall rat but i do like the way this place was made. While most shops were still closed when I explored this place on a Sunday morning, I am sure that Roppongi Hills not only offers shopping but culture as well. You would be able to fund a personal spot just to absorb how magnificent the city pf Tokyo is!

Roppongi Hills is a well-designed complex that combines a shopping center on the lower floors, office spaces in the middle, and museums and observation deck at the top. Its thoughtful architecture and beautiful design make it a pleasant place to explore on foot. Located on the 52nd floor, the Mori Art Museum is definitely worth a visit. The current exhibition showcases the work and vision of Sou Fujimoto - highly recommended

places.address: 6 Chome-10-1 Roppongi, Minato City, Tokyo 106-6108, Japan

places.generalDescription: Shibuya Sky is a 360¬∞ open-air observation deck situated on the top of the Shibuya Scramble Square skyscraper, which is Tokyo's tallest building at 230 meters high. The observation deck consists of two floors: the sky gallery on the 45th floor and the sky stage on the 46th floor. The sky gallery is an enclosed area with cafes, bars, souvenir shops, and artistic video installations that showcase modern Shibuya.

sources.snippet: At 228 metres, it‚Äôs the tallest skyscraper in Shibuya and towers above Shibuya Scramble Square. What makes it unique is that the top floor is open-air with 360¬∫ views of the city including the Shibuya Crossing, Yoyogi Park, Tokyo Tower, Tokyo Stadium, and even Mt Fuji if it‚Äôs clear. You can really appreciate the scale of the huge city.
sources.shortName: 26 Cool Things to Do in Tokyo, Japan (2025)

sources.snippet: This observatory overlooks Tokyo from a height of 230 meters above sea level. The attraction is the view of Shibuya's landmark Shibuya Scramble Crossing, Tokyo Tower, and Mt.
sources.shortName: Tokyo night view spots for a couple's night date

places.name: Shibuya Sky

reviews.text:
Words can't explain how magical it is after dark. It is stunning. So many lights but the lights felt soft and beautiful. It was absolutely incredible. I planned it for the end of our second day in Tokyo to help us stay awake and not go back and sleep.

I booked tickets in advance so we could get after sunset. The lines were long but it was worth it. You are very limited what you can bring outside and you will likely need a locker.

Only negative was so many people doing impromptu photo shoots so it was difficult to find a place to look out.

The photo op spot was super cool.

We loved it. My kids say in the hammock nets for a while and loves it.

Perfect way to end your first days in Tokyo.

It's a beautiful observation deck that is incredibly high! We went at sunset so the views were insane. It's always very crowded/busy so you may have to wait to get the perfect picture. I'd recommend going down the elevator with your camera ready. The lines run very smoothly and the staff are always ready to help.

Make sure you have tickets booked because the likelihood of getting tickets on the day can be quite slim. The line to go up can be a solid wait and we booked the session to catch the sunset and we almost spent it waiting. When you actually reach the ‚Äòtop' it will be crowded with other tourists so expect the best spots to be either taken or also another line made to rotate for photos. There are people guiding movement to ensure less blockages but the view from the top is pretty stunning and I would say it's a must tick box if in the area.

places.generalDescription: Happo-en is a historic venue in Shirokanedai city, featuring a stunning Japanese garden with bonsai trees, koi ponds, and a beautifully maintained lawn. Originally the residence of a samurai general in the early 17th century, it now serves as a picturesque backdrop for traditional Japanese weddings and banquets. The garden spans about 33,000 square meters and includes a chapel, temple, and banquet hall for various events.

sources.snippet: This traditional garden is one of Tokyo‚Äôs most popular wedding photo spots, for good reason‚Äîthe garden is stunning. Maintained for visitors to weddings and other events in the hotel banquet halls, Happo-en isn‚Äôt typically open to the public. However, if you stop for a (slightly pricey) cup of tea at the cafe you can easily slip into the garden for a stroll.

places.name: Happo-en

reviews.text: Free to look around if you're visiting any of the places inside-which I was-but no-one checked anyway. Lovely spot to spend some time in. The bonsai were well worth spending some time to look at, with some over 500 years old.

A beautiful event hall in the middle of Tokyo.  The garden is well designed and displays many of the iconic Japanese inspiration structures.   There is a lake, waterfall, cute little cottages and, of course, a tea house.   It is definitely worth a wonderful walk thru the place and have a wonderful meal at the dining hall.   Overall, a very nice event center.

It is a very nice garden you can enter for free with a beautiful light up after sunset which seems extremely popular with couples.

I had the chance to chat with some of the wedding staff there who were very professional and helpful.

Thank you for providing such a nice location

places.address: 1 Chome-1-1 Shirokanedai, Minato City, Tokyo 108-8631, Japan

places.generalDescription: Jonanjima Seaside Park is a waterfront park located in Jonanjima, Ota-ku, offering stunning views of Tokyo Bay and Haneda Airport. The park features sandy and grassy areas, a campsite, barbecue area, and a skateboarding plaza. It's a popular spot for families and people of all ages to enjoy recreational activities like grilling and bird-watching.

sources.snippet: Jonanjima Seaside Park is located in Jonanjima, Ota-ku, facing Tokyo Bay. The park has a campsite, barbecue area, and skateboarding plaza, making it a popular leisure spot for families and people of all ages. Close to Haneda Airport and the Port of Tokyo, it is an excellent location for fans of ships and aviation.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do, History, Areas, And Recommended Accommodations

sources.snippet: It is a seaside park where you can enjoy camping, barbecue, dog runs, etc. At the artificial sandy beach ‚ÄúTsubasahama‚Äù, you can have a relaxing time while playing with sand and taking walks. And, above all, the selling point here is that you get to see airplanes flying close to Haneda Airport!
sources.siteName: Popular driving spots in Japan | Jalan Rent-a-Car
sources.shortName: 10 recommended spots to see Tokyo's night view during your driving trip! See the romantic and fantastic scenery - Popular driving spots in Japan

places.name: Jonanjima Seaside Park

reviews.text:
2022.10.23
Overlooking Haneda Airport and Tokyo Port, it is a dynamic place that touch the heart of travel and also make you feel insignificant...

Nice spot and park for plane watching..dog walking and fishing!
Parking available till 9pm cost is 100¬•/30mins.

Windy, spacious, BBQ spot, camping site. All of it is true for this place. It's beautiful, and you can have a nice nap in your tent. Near the airport so you can checkout plane every 10/15 minutes. Many photographers comes here to take photo of takeoff. The beach has quite the high tide. But within swimming level.
The information desks are helpful, i had cut my finger during setting up tent. They gave medicine and bandaids with such care.
Definitely worth to visit the place if u want to spend a nice evening, don't forget to take the tent. It tends to get hot there

places.address: 4 Chome-2-2 Jonanjima, Ota City, Tokyo 143-0002, Japan

places.generalDescription: Tamagawa Sengen-jinja Shrine is a historic Shinto complex dating back to the 1100s, featuring pagodas and torii gates. It is dedicated to Konohanasakuyahimenomikoto, a deity associated with cherry blossoms and revered for promoting household harmony, safe childbirth, and safeguarding sea travel, fishery, agriculture, machinery, and fire prevention.

sources.snippet: This shrine enshrines Kihanasakuyahime no Mikoto, the deity of family happiness, easy childbirth, and safe childbirth. Founded over 800 years ago, the shrine‚Äôs history dates back to when Masako Hojo, wife of Lord Minamoto no Yoritomo, rested here while travelling to Mt. Fuji. The shrine‚Äôs red seal, whose design changes monthly, is very popular.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do, History, Areas, And Recommended Accommodations

places.name: Tamagawa Sengen-jinja Shrine

reviews.text:
It's beautiful shrine with a view of Musashikosugi skyline üèô & Mt. Fuji üóª

Shinkansen tracks, Metro lines & Tamagawa river can be seen too.

Surrounded in the peaceful neighborhood.
Slope is not so inclined.

Highly recommended to come here in the evening to catch a glimpse of night view.

Parking facility available in the shrine!

This shrine is so beautiful. And when you enter at your left you will see a magnificent view over Kanagawa prefecture, more precisely what you see is Musashi Kosugi üåâüåÉüåÜ
And on clear days you can also admire Fuji san! ü§ç

The Tamagawa Sengen-jinja Shrine is a very beautiful and very ancient shrine dating from the 11th century.  Everything you read here is true, including the warning that one might get pregnant from ringing the bell at the shrine. Pro-tip:  Go there a bit before sunrise on a clear day, and bring your camera. The sun emerging from behind Mt. Fuji can be spectacular. Bring a jacket, it can get a bit chilly before the sun is up.

places.address: 1 Chome-55-12 Denenchofu, Ota City, Tokyo 145-0071, Japan

places.generalDescription: Rainbow Bridge is a stunning suspension bridge that spans Tokyo Bay, connecting Shibaura Wharf to Daiba. Opened in 1993, it serves as both a transportation route and a beloved landmark for the new Tokyo Bay area. The bridge features vibrant nighttime illumination powered by solar energy and offers a walking route along its 1.7 km length.

sources.snippet: Opened in 1993, Rainbow Bridge is a popular symbol of Tokyo Port. It has a double-layer structure with the lower layer comprising of general roads and the upper layer as a highway where you can drive on either of the two roads. Depending on the season, the lighting pattern on the bridge changes and is called ‚Äúthe art of light‚Äù, thanks to how beautiful it looks.
sources.siteName: Popular driving spots in Japan | Jalan Rent-a-Car
sources.shortName: 10 recommended spots to see Tokyo's night view during your driving trip! See the romantic and fantastic scenery - Popular driving spots in Japan

places.name: Rainbow Bridge

reviews.text: The Rainbow Bridge in Tokyo is a stunning architectural marvel and a must-see attraction. Spanning Tokyo Bay, it offers breathtaking views, especially at night when it's beautifully illuminated. Whether you're walking, driving, or taking a boat tour, the bridge provides a unique perspective of the city's skyline. The pedestrian walkways are perfect for a leisurely stroll with picturesque scenes, making it a favorite spot for both locals and tourists. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Tokyo!

This is definitely something to see the bridge itself looks stunning specially at night when the lights turn on, do keep in mind that if it's not a holiday, the lights will only shine in white or purple. Otherwise, if it's a holiday, it will be a rainbow color. I recommend taking pictures of it or watching it from the Statue of Liberty.

I was staying in Odaiba, and walking across the promenade of the rainbow bridge was an amazing way to get to the Tokyo tower.
The bridge is a great design and is a real focus point of the surrounding area.
It's great to look at it, but if you get the chance, I would definitely recommend walking across.

places.generalDescription: The Tokyo Gate Bridge, completed in 2011, links the eastern part of Tokyo's Koto Ward to the central Shingawa area. It has become a significant landmark and offers stunning views of Mount Fuji from the nearby Wakasu Koen Park. The bridge's unique design has earned it the nickname 'Dinosaur Bridge' due to its resemblance to facing dinosaurs and is a popular spot for night view enthusiasts. With a length of 2,618 meters and a maximum height of 87.

sources.snippet: Thanks to its length, you can enjoy the night view to the fullest while driving. The pink ribbon will be lit up in pink on the corresponding day of the month. As such, depending on the day, there will be a different color.
sources.siteName: Popular driving spots in Japan | Jalan Rent-a-Car
sources.shortName: 10 recommended spots to see Tokyo's night view during your driving trip! See the romantic and fantastic scenery - Popular driving spots in Japan

places.name: Tokyo Gate Bridge

reviews.text: This is an insider tip. Usually I don't post insider tips. (I guess I'm to stingy) But this one is only for the people good on feet. Walking this bridge is an unique experience.
The views during the sunset is stunning

Also known as the dinasour bridge as it looks like two T-Rex facing each other.

It is connecting the islands of odaiba to the eastern part of tokyo and it is national road, no toll.

there is walking passage on the bridge but the height could be as high as 63 metres.

access could be found under the bridge by the wakasu park.

places.generalDescription: Hasunuma Onsen is a neighborhood bathhouse that offers hot and cold spring water pools, as well as a sauna. The establishment now boasts beautiful stained glass and large-scale artworks depicting forests and waterfalls, creating a serene atmosphere for visitors. The interior design is reminiscent of Dogo Onsen in Ehime, with natural hot spring water that is 100% free-flowing and known for its skin-nourishing properties.

sources.snippet: This natural hot spring, with a Taisho-romantic concept, features an interior design reminiscent of Dogo Onsen in Ehime. The light yellowish-brown clear water is 100% free-flowing. The spring is known for its beauty benefits and effectiveness for cuts, chronic skin diseases, and chronic digestive diseases.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do, History, Areas, And Recommended Accommodations

places.name: Hasunuma Onsen

reviews.text:
This is my first time visiting an onsen that wasn't attached to my hotel. When I tell you that this was my best experience yet, I mean it!
Originally my fianc√© and I had stopped by just to get information on the pricing, but due to us having mild Japanese language skills, we ended up buying the service and going in immediately.
By the way, tattoos are allowed~!

Staff: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Their English is good enough to explain everything, as well as the signage being in English as well.

Cost: I believe it was 1,300 yen per person (or maybe that was for both of us?) for access to the baths, sauna and rental towels, which is extremely cheap in my opinion!

Services: here are three baths that vary in size and temperature.
The biggest bath is the hottest, but not as hot as some I've been in previously. (This is a good thing because I was able to stay in much longer than usual without getting overheated.)
The medium bath is carbonated and has a cooler temperature, but is still pretty warm. If you're not good with high heat, I recommend trying this bath first!
The smallest bath is cold, which is great for when you're overheated. I saw some Japanese people use their bowls to take water out for a quick rinse, but I personally enjoyed using it as a cold plunge.
There is also a sauna which costs more then the baths-only, but I highly recommend it. I enjoyed sweating in the dry heat after spending some time in the baths. The sauna room smells like a campfire (loved this) and has some sounds that were nice to listen to while I meditated.

Overall: Definitely a hidden gem in the Kamata area, and one of the best onsen experiences I've had during any of my trips to Japan.
If you're in the area and wondering if you should visit: DO IT! Your body will thank you!

Fantastic sento that allows foreigners with tattoos. Helpful staff with instructions in English. Very reasonably priced at about 500 yen with an extra 300 if you want to use the sauna room. Beautiful and tasteful interior with stained glass and painted walls. Clean changing room. Drinks sold in front. Can't say enough how much I enjoyed this little oasis. Saw many locals coming in for their nightly baths as well so you can see a slice of local life.

I'm a woman and i have a tattoo. It was the nicest experience to take a bath here.

It is the most beautiful sento. The staff is very sweet, funny and nice. Highly recommended!

If you have a tattoo, expect some elderly lady guest to be very curious about it. She may even give you compliments. :)

places.address: 6 Chome-16-11 Nishikamata, Ota City, Tokyo 144-0051, Japan

places.generalDescription: Haneda Airport Terminal 2 Observation Deck provides a casual dining experience with stunning views of the aircraft stands and Tokyo Bay. It offers a different kind of enjoyment compared to Terminal 1's observation deck. The night view is particularly recommended, as the floor is adorned with about 4,000 LED lights known as Stardust Stage, creating a dazzling and enchanting space of light. Located on the fifth floor, it features both indoor and outdoor observation areas.

sources.snippet: Haneda Airport has observation decks at both Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 where they offer you different ways of enjoyment. If you want to enjoy the night view, we recommend the observation deck at Terminal 2. At night, about 4,000 LED lights called ‚ÄúStardust Stage‚Äù are embedded in the floor which creates a glittering and fantastic space of light.
sources.siteName: Popular driving spots in Japan | Jalan Rent-a-Car
sources.shortName: 10 recommended spots to see Tokyo's night view during your driving trip! See the romantic and fantastic scenery - Popular driving spots in Japan

places.name: Terminal 2 Observation Deck

reviews.text: Brilliant facility for planespotters and anyone with an interest in aviation. Cafes and vending machines on the terrace.

Pbservation Deck is on the 5th Floor (5F). Only certain elevators go pas the 3rd floor, so pay attention when you get in an elevator. The elevators going to the 5th Floor are near the circular area.

Great views of airplanes and Tokyo. Air conditioning and indoors, with food options a short walk away. There is also an outdoor portion if you want to smell the JP-8 burning. If you're into airplanes, I recommend stopping here for a bit to get food and views.
Fantastic views of the airfield and the aircraft (predominately ANA). There are 2 sides to the outside decks and lots of seating both inside and out.

places.address: Haneda Airport Domestic Terminal 2, 3 Chome-4-2 Hanedakuko, Ota City, Tokyo 144-0041, Japan
